Background.text:
A potassium binding polymer that unlike
Kayexylate
has not been reported to increase the risk of intestinal necrosis.

Administration.text:
Type: oral powder for suspension
Dosage Forms:
8.4g/packet
16.8g/packet
25.2g/packet
Routes of Administration:
Common Trade Names:

Adult_Dosing.text:
8.4 g PO qDay
May increase or decrease dose as necessary (increments of 8.4 g) not to exceed 25.2 g qDay

Renal_Dosing.text:
Adult: no adjustments
Pediatric: not approved

Hepatic_Dosing.text:
Adult: no adjustment
Pediatric: not approved

Adult: no adjustments

Adult: no adjustment
Pediatric: not approved

Serious.text: Excessive doses > 50g/d can cause profound hypokalemia

Common.text:
Constipation (7.2%)
Hypomagnesemia (5.3%)
Diarrhea (4.8%)
Nausea (2.3%)
Abdominal discomfort (2%)
Flatulence (2%)

Pharmacology.text:
Half-life:
Metabolism: non-absorbed polymer
Excretion: Fecal

Mechanism_of_Action.text: Binds and removes (via sorbitol induced bowel movements) potassium from the GI tract==Comments==
